intro: Sphaerostephanos tibangensis, commonly known as the Tibang mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude meadows and rocky habitats, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
